homes_hear_details: Louisiana's HOMES and HEAR programs are pending launch. The Louisiana Department of Natural Resources is developing program guidelines and implementation plans using approximately $63 million in IRA funding allocated to the state.
state_energy_office: Louisiana Department of Natural Resources - Technology Assessment Division

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in New Orleans, 80% AMI is approximately $55,900. Low-income households will qualify for the highest rebate levels under HOMES when the program launches.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in New Orleans, 150% AMI is approximately $104,850. Moderate-income households will qualify for partial rebates under HOMES when the program launches.

net_metering: Louisiana requires investor-owned utilities to offer net metering for solar systems up to 300 kW. Under Act 147 (2019), the Louisiana Public Service Commission established new rules where net metering customers receive credits at a rate that may be lower than full retail, based on avoided cost methodology plus additional value factors. Grandfathered customers retain previous rates.

state_tax_credits.name: Louisiana Solar Energy System Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 50% of the first $25,000 of installed cost (up to $12,500 credit) for systems installed through 2025. Note: this credit has been modified and reduced in recent years; check current status.
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV systems, solar thermal systems installed on residential properties in Louisiana
state_tax_credits.details: Louisiana's solar tax credit has been one of the most generous in the nation. The credit is refundable and can be claimed in the year the system is placed in service. The program has undergone legislative changes, with the credit amount being gradually reduced. Verify current availability and rates with the Louisiana Department of Revenue.

state_rebate_programs.name: Louisiana Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair and replacement, duct sealing, window and door repairs
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. Administered by community action agencies across Louisiana.

state_rebate_programs.name: Louisiana Home Energy Loan Program (HELP)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Low-interest loans up to $20,000 for energy efficiency improvements
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, HVAC upgrades, windows, doors, solar systems, and other energy efficiency improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Provides low-interest financing for residential energy efficiency improvements. Must get a home energy audit prior to receiving the loan.

programs.name: Entergy Solutions Residential Program
programs.eligible_items: Smart thermostats, HVAC tune-ups, duct sealing, insulation, LED lighting, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.name: Entergy Louisiana Income-Qualified Weatherization
programs.eligible_items: Air sealing, insulation, HVAC repair, LED lighting for income-qualified households

programs.name: SWEPCO Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, central air conditioners, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.name: Cleco Energy Efficiency Programs
programs.eligible_items: HVAC upgrades, smart thermostats, weatherization measures, LED lighting
